intro: Burcardia villosa, commonly known as the hairy burcardia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Burcardia villosa is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
